channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Graffiti along Thames, 17th January
item.description:
Graffiti all along the length of the Thames wall on the Thames beach side. Also in multiple places on Grandad (Grandfather?) Pier on wooden supporting beams. This is all in the area of Coin St.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Queen's Walk, Southwark, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Queen's Walk, Southwark, Greater London

item.title: No more light in billy furry way pathway from Finchley road, 17th January
item.description:
There is no light at all at night in billy furry way, coming from Finchley road. It is dangerous as access to flats are in total darkness, and we have a 4months old with a buggy and need access to Billy furry way to get to our flat. And the street is currently not safe
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Billy Fury Way, West Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Intersection of Arkwright and Frognal, 17th January
item.description:
Since the completion of Arkwright Road works, traffic is still being routed through Frognal to reach Finchley Road creating gridlocks every morning and evening. Non-resident through-traffic is creating dangerous congestion for children at nearby schools. Please update the network management data (one.network) to show the Arkwright diversion as closed and enforce the 'No Through Traffic' restriction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Frognal, South Hampstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal fishing evidence, 17th January
item.description:
Fishing shads package thrown by the lake where "no fishing"sign is on everywhere around this lake. Fishing had been banned around this lake area due to irresponsible littering of fishing equipments hurts even killed wild life. This had been seen or reported repetitively. Water birds or pike's dead body been seen on land who die in vain. Please put some order in place to stop unnessary death of our wild life due to people's few minutes entertainments and negligence to the nature and life.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Five Arches, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole with exposed drain, 17th January
item.description:
Deep pothole with exposed drain. No markings to identify the pothole and in the dark this has caused my car to not only go down a pothole but also hit the corner of the exposed drain and has caused damage to my alloy and suspension.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmstead Lane, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
